chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. Messer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Clerk's cover letter
DNA Proof of Submission
DNA Order and Acknowledgement

01:30 PM Defendant Michael L. Messer in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State indicates Def. has successfully completed DPA so moves Ct. 1 be amended to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1) and recommends costs.  Victim rights laws complied with.  Court orders Ct. 1 amended to Disorderly Conduct, costs ordered to include $200 DNA surcharge, DNA sample.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Payment plan.
Deferred Entry of Judgment

Court calls  @ 11:31 am.  Defendant Michael L. Messer in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Courtney Imig, intern also appears.  State gives plea agreement, plea to ct 1, ct 2 Dismissed.  DEJ for 18 months no contact with victim, no crime @ level of p.c. and comply with bond.  Victim rights complied and submitted a Victim Impact Statement.  Atty Laufenberg and def. agrees.  Court received letter from State and 2 for defense and has review all letters.  Letter from victim mother is sealed but 2 letters from defense aren't.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charge and penalties.  Ct 1 Exposing genitals to a child, no contest plea. Court will DRI ct 2.   Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Laufenberg is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct 1 Exposing genital to child.  State gives statement. Atty Laufenberg gives statement.  Court will approve entry of judgment for 18 months, and signs agreement. Bond remains.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2018 at 11:00 am.
